channel.title: What to print on custom keyboard?
channel.description:
I'm going to get a custom keyboard layout printed, and I can get whatever I want on it, so I thought, why not a Star Trek themed keyboard?
I found some creative commons licensed artwork, trimmed and converted them to SVGs and set up this layout.
Which do you guys think look best?
https://www.moparisthebest.com/kbs.html
Also a sort of related question, I have to pick a color for my keycaps as well. Link to keyboard and available colors are also at the above page.

item.title: What to print on custom keyboard?
item.dc:creator: @D3i7y D3i7y
item.description:
@D3i7y wrote:

I’m using a laptop the same one for about 3 years now. The other one that still works but lesser quality is a gateway intel cerleron. It’s 6 or 7 years old. I have never owned a desktop computer so i use a custom keyboard that was made by a local guy i know. Its black and red almost evil skulls stars.

I would suggest you keep using debian if thats why its on your keyboard. Please do not have an awesome setup and use windows. Do not disappoint me.

Read full topic
item.source: What to print on custom keyboard?

item.title: What to print on custom keyboard?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:15, topic:549473”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=668375.msg4470428#msg4470428 date=1422655927]
$150… What the fudge

Been using this $10 one for 8 years
[/quote]
you actually bought a keyboard? i’ve been getting free ones for purchasing office supplies at staples for years[/quote]

That’s what happens when you don’t have tits… also who the hell purchases office supplies? I get all mine for free.

Read full topic

item.title: What to print on custom keyboard?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“stCky, post:8, topic:549473”]Are Tuvok and Spock keys F5 and F12? Never seen Star Trek :s If so, is there the ability to add a slight grey for F5 to differentiate in greyscale?

Honestly all that gets me is the bright orange keys, for myself I’d use a subtle colour like grey, black or white for these. Then again I’m boring and just sat here designing my own keyboard out of only the grey’s and blue for wasd/arrow keys >_<[/quote]

Tuvok is F11, Spock is F12. Orange is my favorite color so I kind of like the colors, I have plenty of boring grey/black/white keyboards already.

Read full topic
item.source: What to print on custom keyboard?

item.title: What to print on custom keyboard?
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

Are Tuvok and Spock keys F5 and F12? Never seen Star Trek :s If so, is there the ability to add a slight grey for F5 to differentiate in greyscale?

Honestly all that gets me is the bright orange keys, for myself I’d use a subtle colour like grey, black or white for these. Then again I’m boring and just sat here designing my own keyboard out of only the grey’s and blue for wasd/arrow keys >_<

Read full topic
item.source: What to print on custom keyboard?

item.title: What to print on custom keyboard?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Yes this will definitely be one of the nerdiest keyboards ever made, I’ve added a few more touches and background colors for all choices. What do you guys think of the key cap colors?

I’m still kind of leaning towards the colored faces, otherwise tuvok and spock look identical, and data is hard to pick out too.

Read full topic
item.source: What to print on custom keyboard?

I prefer the black & white option, colours do look a little like “cheap plastic”

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

item.source: What to print on custom keyboard?

item.title: What to print on custom keyboard?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I think full color would probably look awfully tacky. I’d probably go black keys with white ink.

I’d probably also include the F1, etc text still on those keys somewhere, maybe in small text in the corners, just to avoid having to count and such, half a second could matter if you need to press F6 during bootup.

Read full topic
